intro: Ilex ptariana, commonly known as the Chinese holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, red berries that persist through winter. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and has a slow growth rate, making it suitable for ornamental landscaping. Its foliage remains green throughout the year, providing year-round visual interest. Ilex ptariana is also valued for its ability to tolerate a range of soil conditions and partial shade.
